posts.title: Your most common worries about social distancing and self-isolation, answered by therapists

description.text: The way coronavirus is affecting our lives can be hard on our mental health. So we asked therapists to answer some of your most common worries about social distancing, self-isolation and coronavirus.
Universal Credit is a single monthly payment from the government. It's meant to cover your living costs and rent if you're out of work or on a low income.

posts.title: What support is available for the self-employed during coronavirus?

description.text: On 26th March 2020, the government announced the Self-employment Income Support Scheme (SEISS), a new initiative to support those who are self-employed throughout the coronavirus outbreak.

posts.title: What support is available for my small business during coronavirus?

description.text: The government has announced a range of initiatives to support small businesses throughout the coronavirus pandemic. We've outlined what's available to help you understand the best options for your business.

posts.title: Here's how the government is helping businesses through coronavirus

description.text: We know that if you're the owner or the employee of a small business, this might be a particularly difficult time for you. We've outlined some of the main points that came out of the Chancellor's speech.

posts.title: Plans cancelled because of coronavirus? Find out if you can get your money back

description.text: If your plans get disrupted or cancelled because of coronavirus, we explain if and how you might be able to get your money back, and what we can do to help.

posts.title: How to avoid scams about coronavirus

description.text: Fraudsters are taking advantage of the coronavirus outbreak. Here's some tips and guidance to identify and avoid these scams.

posts.title: We're here to support you with your money and your Monzo account during the coronavirus outbreak

description.text: We're here to help you as usual, and we're ready to keep doing so.
